paragraphs.name: 9e2a

paragraphs.text: Do you know the feeling of going back and forth with someone who misunderstood your email or text message? How about writing website copy that no one responds to? Or resumes and cover letters that get zero response?

03de
paragraphs.text: Tip #1: Stop Using Standard Phrases
Two Tips That Instantly Improve Your Everyday Writing Forever
Here’s a rule of thumb: Not using a word in speech? Don’t use it in writing.

paragraphs.text: Excelent tips. But lately, I’ve been thinking in a frequent problem I face when I choose a relaxed, more genuine writing style. Once, I was prospecting distributors in Germany for a cosmetic company and not…

e74261479edd.title: Great read and very much on point.

paragraphs.text:
Great read and very much on point. 
I once got criticized for returning and breaking up my emails into “digestable” segments (I’m a graphic designer and have always understood negative space and compartmentalizing large bodies of text), and reading this solidified my judgment calls. Don’t get me wrong content must always be tailored for your audience…

c84baee0723d.title: Valid points that writing is absolutely relevant and still useful in our lives, despite how much we…

paragraphs.text: Valid points that writing is absolutely relevant and still useful in our lives, despite how much we praise talkative people. We probably write more than talk these days actually. We may respond to the written word more than the spoken one these days.
